result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. SANDERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary as repeater-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time work and/or job search combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Continue with his mental health treatment.  

Take all medications as prescribed and in prescribed doses.

Have no contact with Rahr West Museum, St. John's United Church of Christ, St. Vincent DePaul, Stephanie Bowman and Diane Murray.

Submit DNA sample.

charges.descr: Criminal Trespass to Dwelling as repeater
Criminal Damage to Property as repeater

State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and have no contact with St. John's United Church of Christ in Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished.  The defendant failed to report to the Clerk of Court office after court.
WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING - 
The defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing and is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defendant.
Not guilty pleas entered. Jury calendar.
Further dates will be set once report is filed on another pending case.
